data: Consider Admission/Transfer if:  - Multiple TIAs OR  - Symptoms and signs of Middle Cerebral Artery involvement over 10 minutes' duration (e.g. upper extremity motor weakness or aphasia) OR  - Atrial fibrillation OR   Severe carotid stenosis (70 to 99%)
If CT is normal or no CT available and history consistent with ischemic stroke: give initial dose of the following prior to discharge and provide outpatient prescription for:
325 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
325 mg, NG-tube, once, drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
80 mg, PO, qdaily, dispense qty: 90 tab
325 mg, PO, qdaily, dispense qty: 90 tab
300 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
300 mg, NG-tube, once, drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
75 mg, PO, qdaily, dispense qty: 90 tab
If on ASA prior to event, instruct patient to discontinue ASA and provide outpatient prescription
T;N, Instruct patient to discontinue ASA
Blood, Routine, Collection: T;N, once, Order for future visit
Blood, Routine, Collection: T;N, once, Order for future visit
Blood, Routine, Collection: T;N, once, Order for future visit
Blood, Routine, Collection: T;N, once, Order for future visit
Blood, Routine, Collection: T;N, once, Order for future visit
